-"SaxaVord granted spaceport licence by UK Civil Aviation Authority". Civil Aviation Authority. 17 December 2023. Retrieved 17 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Michelle Mone says that, under specific circumstances, she could benefit from some of the profits made by personal protective equipment sold to the UK government during the COVID-19 pandemic by a company run by her husband, Doug Barrowman.

links.text: -Kuenssberg, Laura (17 December 2023). "Michelle Mone admits she stands to benefit from £60m PPE profit". BBC News. Retrieved 17 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Ian Wright announces that he will step down as a pundit from Match of the Day at the end of the premier league season.

links.text: -"Wright to leave MOTD as pundit at end of season". BBC Sport. Retrieved 17 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Fezolinetant, a non-hormonal drug used to treat menopause-related hot flushes and night sweats, is approved for use in the UK.

links.text: -Roberts, Michelle (18 December 2023). "Hot-flushes menopause drug Veoza approved in UK". BBC News. Retrieved 18 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Chief Veterinary Officer Christine Middlemiss confirms that 4,000 American XL bully dog owners have applied for exemption from a forthcoming ban on the breed, but warns there could be more XL bullies living in the UK.

links.text: -Gregory, James (18 December 2023). "4,000 bully XL owners apply for exemption from ban". BBC News. Retrieved 18 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: A dress worn by Diana, Princess of Wales in 1985 sells at an auction for £904,262 ($1,148,080), eleven times its estimated price.

links.text: -"Princess Diana dress sells for record £900,000 at auction". BBC News. 18 December 2023. Retrieved 18 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Speaking on BBC Radio 4's The Today Podcast, television presenter Dame Esther Rantzen, who has been diagnosed with stage four lung cancer, reveals that she has joined the Dignitas organisation and plans to "buzz off to Zurich" if her treatment does not work. Her comments reopen the debate about assisted dying in the United Kingdom.

links.text: -Hancock, Sam; Zeffman, Henry (20 December 2023). "Esther Rantzen: Minister says he is 'not averse' to new assisted dying vote". BBC News. Retrieved 20 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: The UK government publishes new guidelines advising schools in England on how to deal with pupils who wish to change their gender, be known under a different name or wear a different uniform, urging schools to "take a very cautious approach" and to inform parents of any gender related issues.

links.text: -Moss, Lauren; Parry, Josh (19 December 2023). "Transgender guidance: Schools to keep parents informed". BBC News. Retrieved 19 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: DNA profiling of a 2,000-year-old skeleton unearthed in Cambridgeshire provides evidence that a nomadic race of people from Southern Russia, known as Sarmatians, travelled to Britain during the Roman era.

links.text: -"DNA sleuths solve mystery of the 2,000-year old corpse". BBC News. 19 December 2023. Retrieved 19 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Independent and former Conservative MP Peter Bone loses his seat following a recall petition, triggering a by-election in Wellingborough.

links.text: -"Peter Bone MP loses seat as recall petition triggers by-election". BBC News. 19 December 2023. Retrieved 19 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: The British Museum signs a £50m deal with BP to help it fund a major renovation project.

links.text: -Seddon, Sean (19 December 2023). "British Museum signs £50m funding deal with BP". BBC News. Retrieved 19 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Data from the Office for National Statistics shows UK inflation fell to 3.9% in November 2023, the lowest for more than two years, down from 4.6% the previous month. The fall, which is sharper than expected, is largely attributed to fuel and food costs declining and household goods prices 'slowing'. The Bank of England's target for inflation is 2%.

links.text: -Race, Michael (20 December 2023). "UK tipped for speedier rate cut after inflation fall". BBC News. Retrieved 20 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Tánaiste Micheál Martin announces Irish government plans to "initiate an inter-State case against the United Kingdom under the European Convention on Human Rights" over provisions in the Northern Ireland Troubles (Legacy and Reconciliation) Act 2023 which offers immunity from prosecution for certain Troubles-era related offences.

links.text: -"Troubles legacy act: Ireland takes human rights case against UK". BBC News. 20 December 2023. Retrieved 20 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Junior doctors in England begin another three-day strike over their long-running pay dispute.

links.text: -Triggle, Nick (20 December 2023). "Disruption warning as junior doctor strikes return". BBC News. Retrieved 20 December 2023.-

links.text: -"JN.1 Covid variant: WHO charts its rapid global spread". BBC News. 20 December 2023. Retrieved 20 December 2023.-

links.text: -"Teenage boy and girl guilty of Brianna Ghey murder". BBC News. 20 December 2023. Retrieved 20 December 2023.-

links.text: -"Thousands of homes still without power after Storm Gerrit". BBC News. 28 December 2023. Retrieved 28 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Three men die after a four by four goes into the River Esk in North Yorkshire.

links.text: -"Three men die after becoming trapped in 4x4 in Yorkshire river". Sky News. Retrieved 28 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: The UK Health Security Agency says that at least 30 cases of E.coli may be linked to cheese brands recalled on Christmas Day.

links.text: -"At least 30 E.coli cases may be linked to recalled cheese – HSA". BBC News. 28 December 2023. Retrieved 28 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Confidential papers released by the UK government show that former prime minister Tony Blair was keen for an English Premiership football club to move to Belfast, because he felt it would be a "significant breakthrough if Belfast had a football team playing in the English Premier League". Discussions were also held in the 1990s about relocating Wimbledon F.C. to Belfast because Wimbledon needed to move from its Plough Lane stadium as a result of the findings of the Taylor Report into the Hillsborough disaster. It was suggested the club could be renamed Belfast United.

links.text: -"Blair was keen on Wimbledon FC relocating to Belfast". BBC News. 28 December 2023. Retrieved 28 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: BBC News reports that a person has died in Scotland following an E.coli outbreak linked to cheese.

links.text: -Roberts, Michelle (29 December 2023). "One dead following cheese recall over E. coli". BBC News. Retrieved 29 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Newly released government documents from 2003 show that then-Prime Minister Tony Blair was presented with measures to tackle immigration that included constructing a detention camp on the Isle of Mull and breaking international law.

links.text: -Berg, Sanchia (29 December 2023). "Tony Blair urged 'radical' measures to cut asylum, archive papers reveal". BBC News. Retrieved 29 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: 2024 New Year Honours Those recognised include Alexander McCall Smith (KBE), Tim Martin (KBE), Stuart Broad (CBE), Sir Ridley Scott (GBE), Shirley Bassey (CH), Michael Eavis (KBE), Jilly Cooper (DBE), Sajid Javid (KBE), Margaret Beckett (DBE), Mary Earps (MBE), Emilia Clarke (MBE), Millie Bright (OBE) and Leona Lewis (OBE).

links.text: -Bell, Sarah (29 December 2023). "New Year Honours 2024: Michael Eavis and Jilly Cooper lead list". BBC News. Retrieved 29 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: The UK government says that a report published on the GOV.UK website on 27 December that said housing asylum seekers on the Bibby Stockholm barge was discriminatory on the grounds of age and sex was published by mistake. The report is deleted from the website.

links.text: -Andrews, Charlotte (30 December 2023). "Bibby Stockholm discrimination report 'published in error'". BBC News. BBC. Retrieved 30 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Eurostar services to and from London St Pancras are cancelled because of a flood in a tunnel under the River Thames.

links.text: -Faulkner, Doug; Jones, Harrison (30 December 2023). "Eurostar cancels all today's trains after tunnel floods". BBC News. BBC. Retrieved 30 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: British Army officer Preet Chandi becomes the fastest woman to complete a trek to the South Pole on skis.

links.text: -Noble, Samantha (30 December 2023). "Preet Chandi: Army officer 'fastest' woman to ski to South Pole". BBC News. BBC. Retrieved 30 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Four police officers are injured and eight people arrested following a demonstration in Camberwell, south London, relating to tensions in the local Eritrean community.

links.text: -"Four police officers injured in south London clash". BBC News. BBC. 30 December 2023. Retrieved 30 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: American XL bully dogs are added to the list of banned species under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991 in England and Wales, requiring them to be on a lead and muzzled in public. It is also illegal to breed, sell or abandon the dogs.

links.text: -"American bully XL dogs must now be kept on a lead". 31 December 2023. Retrieved 31 December 2023 – via www.bbc.co.uk.-

Data.event_text: Eurostar resumes services to and from London St Pancras following the previous day's disruption.

links.text: -Jones, Harrison; Faulkner, Doug (30 December 2023). "Eurostar services resume after major disruption". BBC News. BBC. Retrieved 31 December 2023.-

Data.event_text: Two people killed in an avalanche at the French ski resort of Saint-Gervais-les-Bains on 28 December are named as British mother and son Kate and Archie Vokes.

links.text: -Jones, Harrison (31 December 2023). "Family 'heartbroken' after Britons die in avalanche". BBC News. BBC. Retrieved 1 January 2024.-
